data.name: Tsiolkovsky rocket equation
data.description:
# Background:
Ever wanted to become a rocket scientist?
Let's start by making a simple ideal rocket equation calculator.
Your answer should calculate the maximum change of velocity of the rocket using the equation below (delta v).

![equation](https://i.imgur.com/B1AmHhm.png)

This kata is an implementation of the [Tsiolkovsky rocket equation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsiolkovsky_rocket_equation)

## Note

All inputs will be numeric, but you should check that final mass is less than the initial mass. If so, you should throw/return an error.

## Units
* initialSpeed: km/s
* effectiveExhaustVelocity: km/s
* initialMass (m0): kg
* finalMass (m1): kg
* (return value) maximum change of velocity: km/s

Checked via Wolfram Alpha's implementation
